titleStmt.title: J. B. Nones to James W. Tate
CWG2575

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, Kentucky

body.p: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your kind favor of 15th. Inst. relative to the near Expiration of my Commn. as Commr. of Kentucky for New York, for which please receive my kindest acknowledgments.

I herewith transmit $5. referred to, in your last respected favor -- and shall Esteem a favor if of His Excellency the Governor, will renew my Commission, & will feel obliged to you for your agency in the premises.

I am Dr. Sir with respect
Your obdt. Sevt.
J. B. Nones

James W. Tate Esqr.
Asst. Sect. of State
Frankfort Ky

New York
Comr. of Deeds
Jos. B. Nones
N.Y. City
Com Issd. Oct 25. 1861
